keyword: how many calories are in an old fashioned
title: How Many Calories Are in an Old Fashioned?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in an old fashioned cocktail, including carbs from sugar, alcohol content, and variations for your favorite whiskey drink.
h1: How Many Calories Are in an Old Fashioned?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2 oz bourbon whiskey (80 proof), 1 sugar cube (~4 g), 2 dashes bitters, orange twist; served on the rocks, no added soda.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by whiskey brand, proof, sugar amount, and recipe tweaks like added fruit or syrup. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: An Old Fashioned cocktail contains about 155 calories, primarily from the bourbon and sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 1/2 oz simple syrup instead of sugar cube
Higher proof whiskey (100 proof vs. 80 proof)

faqs.q: How many calories are in an old fashioned without sugar?
faqs.a: About 140 kcal, mostly from the 2 oz bourbon.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Around 4 g carbs per cocktail, all from the sugar cube.

faqs.q: Does the type of whiskey affect calories in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”higher proof whiskeys add ~10-20 kcal due to more alcohol.

faqs.q: Are there any fats or proteins in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: No significant amounts; it's primarily alcohol and simple carbs.

faqs.q: How does an old fashioned compare calorie-wise to other cocktails?
faqs.a: Lower than sugary mixes like margaritas (~200+ kcal) but similar to neat spirits.
